ratings.comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. Lectures were long- she would write in complete sentences, so ideas that would normally take 10 min to get across took her an hour. Tests were "easy," but she would take points off for the most ridiculous things... On the second midterm, I got every right answer but got 70%. Awful professor- DO NOT TAKE

She has trouble explaining the material in a timely fashion, will rarely do an example problem, and if she does  she probably won't show her work. Homework is extremely short and doesn't help you grasp the material. Exams questions are conceptual, while homework questions are computational.  Very little material to help learn the different concepts

Terrible class. Tests are so deceptive. They seem short but almost everyone ran out of time before they could finish because of how tricky they were. Professor is extremely pedantic. Will take points off of work for the most ridiculous things.

This class was beyond easy. Exams are just like the notes. Notes are written out along with the class, so it's impossible to miss anything. The project is easy if you can read and write. You shouldn't need the curve. Got a 75 on the first exam, but finished strong with an A in the class. She's a great professor. She's funny and relatable. Take her!
Class was curved as I did better than I expected. Tests were long but fair. She is very helpful if you visit office hours and put in the effort. The textbook sucked.

WORST CLASS EVER. She grades extremely harshly on the homeworkproject and the exams have a lot of trick questions. She makes a class that should be relatively straight forward way more challenging than necessary. Her method for "curving" the class is very confusing, says she will shift the entire class up a grade but definitely didn't.

To me, her attempts to explain statistics in a less mathematical way just made things more confusing, and her lecture style was kind of annoying. She has a tendency to write out word for word everything she says, which make lectures move pretty slow. Tests are straight forward, questions often coming directly from the notes. Textbook was godawful

Gina is a truly great professor. She did the impossible and made Stats interesting. She doesn't have class Friday, but instead has you read an online statistics article or two and take a mini quiz on it. Not really hard but really interesting. One of my favorite professors at UW so far.

Gina is a great teacher. She goes through everything slow enough for you to write it down and follow along, and gives lots of examples.  No lectures on Fridays, instead you just read some articles (which were actually kinda interesting) and then take an  easy online quiz. Overall, great teacher for a boring, useless class.

Gina is wonderful. She is closer to our age than most professors which is a bonus. Her new "modern" approach to stats is awesome and super easy to follow along. She really makes stats interesting and enjoyable. Also she's funny and cute.  Best part is that she doesn't have lectures on friday!
Gina is a great teacher.  If you attend class and pay attention it should be a relatively easy class.  She gives you the tools to be successful.  Definitely take the class with her
Gina is awesome. Allows cheatsheet on exams, which makes everything much easier. I wouldn't change a thing about how she teaches. Take her.
